website_summaries.verdict: Great combination of affordability and surprising above-class performance in a small package.
pros: One of the few car amplifiers that offers around 3,000 watts of maximum power output at this price point
Audio quality is clear, with better dynamics
Variable low pass crossover, bass boost, and subsonic filter allow you to customize the sound
Incredible performance in a slim, compact design
cons: Cable connects don't always fit to existing car systems

customer_reviews.title: Not as powerful as claimed
customer_reviews.text: It's a Boss product, so it's not top of the line but you do probably get around 950 watts RMS which isn't awful for the price but it's no 3k amp. It has worked very reliably but clips at a little over half gain on 23 of 25 volume on a 1750 RMS SSA 12 inch sub. Looks real good though. Note: in the picture there is a black strip to the left of the logo, that's an LED light strip I installed for effect.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Harrison

customer_reviews.title: For the price and size it's awesome
customer_reviews.text: For the price you really can't beat what this amp can do. Sure its probably no where close to 3k watts but for what it delivers it pushes my 2 12" subs a lot better than my older name brand amp. Boss back in the 90's was really pretty bad but they have remained a low price alternative and I think this amp is really great for the money. Chances are you are not entering a bass competition, so to drive a couple subs with a smaller amp this is perfect. I have only had this installed for a day but if anything changes I will be sure to update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent
customer_reviews.text: If this thing did half of what it does at this price I couldn't complain. Excellent power, sound, & quality I have it powering a 12" TS-W3001D4 in a sealed box, midsize SUV...getting punched in the back never felt so good. Excellent value for the price, great entry D amp. Didnt need a cap or another batt., doesnt dim lights or anything when it hits, has yet to get as hot as my phone gets...love the knob control it comes with...best part is the deck was $18.00 at walmart...crazy sound for $200 total...sealed box is diy to speaker's recommended specs...put my neighbors 2 10" Kicker Comp VR to shame...
customer_reviews.author: TommyGunz

customer_reviews.title: Wired at 1.33ohm
customer_reviews.text: Dont listen to the bad reviews of people trying to wire this amp to 3,000w @ 4ohm, it won't work. HOWEVER, if you read the details and know how to wire your speakers, this thing is a beast!!!! I have this wired at 1.33ohm with 2x 8" speakers @ 600w max and a single 10" @ 800w max and this amp shakes them like crazy and does not even get warm. My speakers are 4ohm @ 2000w max, keep this amp at 1-2ohms and it's a beast.
customer_reviews.author: Pepper power

customer_reviews.title: cheap amp that really only pushes about 150 watts RMS power so steer clear if you want real power
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this amp claims to put out 3000 watts at max power but has no explanation of real rms power which is what you really want to know. I just installed the amp and the power it really puts out is a little disappointing for what’s advertised. It is a relatively weak amp for wats advertised and I wish I could return the product but unfortunately by the time I could give it a try from when I ordered it the return window closed. I just really wish I was a bit more satisfied with the product but at this point i’m unable to return the amp and purchase something with some real power.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Scherr

customer_reviews.title: Boom boom boom boom😍😍😍😍😍
customer_reviews.text: DONT be fooled by this amps physical size. This thing thumps like a demon! I love this amp. I love how compact it is and the fact that it has an external gain control. But although I haven’t used it yet I also like the fact you can connect two or more to gather and piggy back them by controlling the one unit no more 100 of meters of in nessesary cabling. Love it love it.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley B.

customer_reviews.title: This isn’t worth a dollar
customer_reviews.text: I had this amp for only 6 months with my Rockford fosgates P3 and this wasn’t worth the money one day I was driving down the road and it started smoking and caught fire I’m never buying a boss amp again
customer_reviews.author: Zach Daugherty

customer_reviews.title: I bought this amplifier in April now it burnt out ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this amplifier in April now it burnt out I'm only running one sub on it I don't have the volume all the way up and it still burned the green and red light is just blinking going crazy when I plug it into the speaker all it does is pulsate I thought it was the speaker so I bought another one and it still does the same thing I check my wires I checked everything and it seems to be just the amplifier is no good

customer_reviews.title: I Say Yes!
customer_reviews.text: The power for price is very worth it. Even the master bass controller that can run into your cab is awesome. My personal set up was 2 12” Pioneer (yes Pioneer) TS-W3003D4 Champion coils in a custom sealed (yes sealed, not ported) box. The only problem was that I ran 0 guage wire for the ground and power, and I had a fun time fitting that into the slots this amp has. But besides that, I have these bad boys thumping in the back of my G6.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only expect half the peak power
customer_reviews.text: I didnt expect this to be anywhere near the 3000 watts peak it claims. However i am running the mtx terminator subs and am pretty impressed. For under $300 i have an amp and subs that hit pretty hard and clean.

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointed
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 Boss D12F subs under the rear seat in my xcab Silverado. This amp made them come alive for about a month the it overheated. With the back seat up it would get very warm, so the subs were off when the seat was down. It overheated anyway. Sent it back, got new one installed, this time mounted to the seat back. Overheated again. Now I have the original amp (Boss R2000M) I bought with the subs back in with no problems. These subs are 1,000 watts each, the R2000M is a little underpowered to handle these 2, and the AR3000 should be somewhat overkill. Great bang for buck, just gotta keep it cool.

customer_reviews.title: 750 watts probably ain't bad for a pair of mediocre 10s or maybe a ...
customer_reviews.text: This amp on a dyno made a dismal 764 watts on 2 ohms. I had another china made 1200 watt amp that outperformed this one by far. I wouldn't spend my money expecting this one to do anywhere near max power. I have this on two Kicker CVR 15s and it shuts off every 30-40 minutes from overheating. For under 100 bucks, 750 watts probably ain't bad for a pair of mediocre 10s or maybe a single 12. Not cracked up to what it's supposed to be.

customer_reviews.title: I had an old school Rockford 100x2 hooked up at 4 ohms and it felt like I had 2 more subs then I do now
customer_reviews.text: Have this hooked up to a 2 Rockford Fosgate R2 Ultra Shallow 10-Inch 4 Ohm DVC Subwoofers at 1 ohm. My guess is this amp is actually putting out about 300-400 watts RMS at 1 ohm. I had an old school Rockford 100x2 hooked up at 4 ohms and it felt like I had 2 more subs then I do now. Amp seems to work very well, and fits better under the seat of my F150 and I like having a remote bass control. But if you are buying this amp for 1000 watts RMS or better, then you will be disappointed. This amp would have gotten 5 stars if it could have been able to over drive these subs.
customer_reviews.author: Randy N.

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT BASS FOR THE PRICE.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my husband, he loves it. He even did an unbox in of it on his youtube channel Mr. Ideel. It has beautiful round bass. It's a very pleasant surprise for the price point. Very affordable and more than average bass. GREAT CHOICE! 👏👍
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.B

customer_reviews.title: Works good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works good for the price. It does however distort at 3/4 gain. Not entirely sure if its the deck or this causing the output. Make sure to hook up your oscilloscope to make sure your sine wave is good and not distorted to prevent sub damage. Otherwise well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Dustin S

customer_reviews.title: good 300w amp not 3000w
customer_reviews.text: This amp is not even close to the RMS ratings listed on Amazon will not push two p2 subs I would gess you are looking at a 200 – 300 w amp at 4 ohms if you are lucky not a bad amp if call it what it is a sub 250 amp
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Beaten 4 12 inch kickers hard 🖒🖒 highly recommended just set your gains right and youll be knocken ...
customer_reviews.text: Beaten 4 12 inch kickers hard 🖒🖒 highly recommended just set your gains right and youll be knocken pictures off tha wall😎
customer_reviews.author: Fabian

customer_reviews.title: good amp for money not 3000 watts but well worth your time and cash for 100 bucks u cant beat boss with a stick ..
customer_reviews.text: little under powerd its no way shape or form 3000 watts not even close but for the price it works well does not over heat if u run it properly right sized wires right ohms ect... i do recomend it for some one with a low buget like me it bangs my 2 12s jl w-3s at 2 ohms and turned 3/4 way up ..........
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

product_meta.title: BOSS Audio Systems AR3000D Class D Car Amplifier - 3000 Watts, 1 Ohm Stable, Digital, Monoblock, Mosfet Power Supply
product_meta.description: Kick your Bass into high gear with the Boss Audio Armor AR3000D Class D Monoblock Amplifier. This powerful 1-Ohm stable amplifier features 3000 Watts Max Power with a MOSFET power supply to get your tunes rocking. Customize the sound with Variable Low Pass Crossover, Bass Boost and Subsonic Filter. Maximize the Bass with the Remote Subwoofer Control. For double the performance and power, strap on another AR3000D for a total power of 6,000 Watts @2-Ohms. The Armor Series of Amplifiers packs incredible power and performance into a feature-rich slim design for put-it-anywhere convenience. Give power to your playlists with the Boss Audio AR3000D. For further product details, please scroll down.
feature_bullets: Power - 3000 Watts Max x 1 @1-Ohm, 1500 Watts Max x 1 @2-Ohms, 750 Watts Max x 1 @4-Ohms, 6000 Watts Max Bridged x 1 @2-Ohms

Class D - Power loss is significantly reduced making the amplifier highly efficient. Excess energy is stored until it’s needed instead of being converted into heat. Reduction in size/weight, reduced power waste, smaller heat sink, compact circuitry

1 Ohm Stable - Able to continuously power loads of 1 Ohm without encountering difficulties such as overheating. Typically made to power up subwoofers that demand the heavier power load requirements to be able to perform the way they were made to

Strapping Capable - You are able to strap two AR3000D amplifiers and double the power that is being sent to your subwoofer(s). You now have the ability to connect more subwoofers to take advantage of the extra power

Variable Subsonic Filter - To prevent your subwoofer(s) from bottoming out, the variable subsonic filter filters out frequencies below the subwoofer(s) specified low frequency limits and allows the driver to reach a maximum safe excursion
Variable Low-Pass Crossover - Subwoofers reproduce sound based on a number of different low-range frequencies. You can set exact sound specifications for the bass frequency reproduction

Warranty - BOSS Audio Systems provides a powerful 6-year Platinum Online Dealer Warranty so long as the purchase is made through Amazon.com. We strongly encourage professional installation of this product to ensure proper and safe functionality

specifications.Warranty: 6 Year Platinum Online Dealer Warranty valid only on products Sold / Shipped by Amazon.com. This offer is not valid on purchases made from third party market place sellers
